ReportText: CLINICAL DATA: Shortness of breath, cough, and wheezing for the past 2 weeks. History of COPD, previous episodes of pneumonia, coronary artery disease, and previous MI. EXAM: CHEST 2 VIEW COMPARISON: PA and lateral chest x-ray of [DATE] FINDINGS: The lungs are adequately inflated. The interstitial markings are coarse. There is no alveolar infiltrate or pleural effusion. The heart and pulmonary vascularity are normal. The mediastinum is normal in width. The bony thorax exhibits no acute abnormality. IMPRESSION: Mild chronic bronchitic changes. No alveolar pneumonia nor CHF. Electronically Signed By: [[PERSONALNAME]] [[PERSONALNAME] Electronically Signed By: [[PERSONALNAME] On: 07/28/2018 12:39
